titleInfo.title: Thèbes, Temple de Ramaseum, Intérieur de la Salle Hypostile

mods.abstract: Hypostyle Hall, Temple of Rameses II (Ramesseum) at the Theban Plain, West Thebes (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); open papyrus columns of the hypostyle hall of the mortuary Temple of Rameses II heavily inscribed with cartouches indentifying Rameses II, hieroglyphs, and other Egyptian motifs; three Egyptian boys before ruins and "Ozymandias" statue (background); "No 109 Thèbes, Temple de Ramaseum, Intérieur de la Salle Hypostile H. Bechard" in white along bottom of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
